entries.meaning: (US, slang) A police officer assigned to a university campus.
examples: Baker Fountain [is] fun to run through, if you can avoid slipping or getting busted by the Campos.

description: Spanish campo and/or Portuguese campo. Doublet of camp and campus.

entries.meaning: A field or plain in a Spanish- or Portuguese-speaking area.
examples: [...], from the bare table-land of Mexico, and their great scarcity on the open campos of the interior of Brasil.
